issue.title: Clear documentation on identification methods
issue.body: Hi. I'm was referring to [this ](https://www.pywhy.org/dowhy/v0.6/example_notebooks/dowhy-simple-iv-example.html) tutorial. I am unable to read/ understand what does it mean by Estimand expression & Estimand assumption 1 & 2. This is you could also see in the picture below. Could you please clarify it, or suggest some material (paper/ website) from where I can understand it? Thank you in advance!

comment.body: This issue is stale because it has been open for 14 days with no activity.

issue.title: Backdoor path
issue.body: Hi. I have the following causal graph (chain structure). According to my knowledge, there is no backdoor path. But when I do model.identify_effect, it shows that there is a backdoor path. Please see it in the following figure. Although, the backdoor set is empty, which is the variable or the set of variables that should be conditioned on block the backdoor path afaik. I do not understand why it says that there is a backdoor on the first place. Please find it in this pic. Also if I rearrange the chain structure into this one And again identify the effect, I still get backdoor expression which you can see here Could you please explain me what am I missing? Thank you in advance!

comment.body: This issue is stale because it has been open for 14 days with no activity.

pull_request.title: Add new GCM model evaluation module
pull_request.body:
This module adds a new method for evaluating a fitted gcm. Here, we evaluate the performance of causal mechanisms, the underlying modeling assumptions (if possible), the goodness of the generated joint distribution and the graph structure. This utilizes some of the existing methods, but also introduces new ones.

This futher adds a new user guide entry demonstrating the usage.

repo.name: dowhy
repo.description: DoWhy is a Python library for causal inference that supports explicit modeling and testing of causal assumptions. DoWhy is based on a unified language for causal inference, combining causal graphical models and potential outcomes frameworks.

issue.title: Proposal: Finalize functional API refactor - deprecate causal graph
issue.body:
- The graph should now be defined via a networkx graph. Most identification methods now expect an additional "observed_nodes" parameter accordingly.
- CausalModel and CausalGraph still exist and should be compatible with the old API.

Open task is still to replace the usage of CausalModel in the tests and notebooks. There are also some smaller details with the identification methods, which should be double checked.

comment.body: This PR is stale because it has been open for 60 days with no activity.
